alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 5:17PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Berks, western Lehigh and southwestern Carbon Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tamaqua to near Shoemakersville to near Adamstown. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reading, Lehighton, Wyomissing, Palmerton, Birdsboro, Kutztown, Jim Thorpe, Hamburg, Slatington, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Nesquehoning, Womelsdorf, Weatherly, Wernersville, Topton, Robesonia, Leesport and Shoemakersville. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 297. Northeast Extension between mile markers 57 and 80. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 23 and 54. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
